Read full topic

item.title: Traps I know about
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

SH*TTT. ive been working on random mouse movements as many have, and i just tested my new trick. i doubt anyone is going to believe this. its a function that fits a random cubic function between two points. the cubic function is so close to being human like, it even moves toward a point near the target, re adjusts, then overshoots to a random radius, fits another random cubic, then moves there. the thing is, ive worked out tonnes of acceleration controls and things based on my own movements, then i stuck it into a script that did tutorial island, and it was banned.

what do i think there doing:
i think the third type of mouse movement that Scar doesnt detect is simply random mouse movement. but it cant be that simple, so i think its also got something to do with hovering over potential targets. ill try working on another script, but im, well, impressed.

Read full topic

item.title: Traps I know about
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ferty, post:7, topic:326”]you know you should make the uid like a hash code of the username for example, becuase a new random uid evrytime tells jagex your constantly deleting the uid.dat which seems suspicious. This way each username has its own specific uid which makes it look like a differant person on each account unless they are checking ips

or you could look at how aryan stores its uids for each account for those over acheivers out there[/quote]

Hah, a program I use to clean my comp(cleans cookies, firefox history and all the other junk witch clutters your pc up) delete’s .dat files if you want it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Traps I know about

item.description:
@Ferty wrote:

you know you should make the uid like a hash code of the username for example, becuase a new random uid evrytime tells jagex your constantly deleting the uid.dat which seems suspicious. This way each username has its own specific uid which makes it look like a differant person on each account unless they are checking ips

or you could look at how aryan stores its uids for each account for those over acheivers out there

item.title: Traps I know about
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

better add this one if your not running it in a custom jframe or a webpage, because if you run it in jagex’s frame this will tell jagex so and you will be immediatly banned:

search for “0x3f008edd” in client.java, there is only one, and its in an if statement, // comment out the 2 lines in that if statement, it should be this line and the one above it, have fun

Read full topic

item.title: Traps I know about
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

For the ‘::’ thing delete

                        aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method397(7, 82);
                        aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method398(aString951.length() - 1);
                        aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method405(aString951.substring(2));

Or make your commands to work with ‘/’ or something similar

Read full topic

item.title: Traps I know about
item.dc:creator: @subasteve subasteve
item.description:
@subasteve wrote:

This will help you in making a bot and reduce your chances of being banned.

debos here: http://www.sieg-heil.org/index.php?path=auto_deob/

[center]contents

  1. signlink
    a.uid
    b.error report

  2. client
    a.window check
    b. :: report

[size=16pt]1. signlink[/size]

a. uid[/center]

open up /sign/signlink.java

find:

private static final int getuid(String s)

and replace with this

private static final int getuid(String s) { return (int)(Math.random() * 99999999D); }
That makes it where if one of your players gets banned all the other players won’t go down with him

[center]b. error report[/center]

find:

public static boolean reporterror = true;

and replace with

public static boolean reporterror = false;

That makes in not report errors to fagex

[center][size=16pt]2. client[/size]

a.windo check[/center]

find:

boolean flag = false; String s = method94(0); if(s.endsWith("jagex.com")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("runescape.com")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.2")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.231")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.229")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.228")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.227")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.226")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.224")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.223")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("192.168.1.221")) flag = true; if(s.endsWith("127.0.0.1")) flag = true; if(!flag) { aBoolean925 = true; return; }

and replace with

[code] boolean flag = true;
String s = method94(0);
if(s.endsWith(“jagex.com”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“runescape.com”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.2”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.231”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.229”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.228”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.227”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.226”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.224”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.223”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“192.168.1.221”))
flag = true;
if(s.endsWith(“127.0.0.1”))
flag = true;
if(!flag)
{

    }[/code]

That checks if your running from there site

find: if(super.aFrame_Sub1_16 != null) { aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method397(7, 226); aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method402(0x3f008edd); }

replace with

[code] if(super.aFrame_Sub1_16 != null)
{

    }[/code]

this one checks jframe thanks to moparisthebest
[center]

b. :: report[/center]

find:

if(aString951.startsWith("::")) { aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method397(7, 82); aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method398(aString951.length() - 1); aClass22_Sub1_Sub4_1145.method405(aString951.substring(2)); }

and replace with

[code]if(aString951.startsWith("::"))
{

                }[/code]

thanks to vortex for that one

That is all I can think of right now, Happy Hacking!

Read full topic
